column4: on Lucid, nautilus does not respect my files permission, i have created files and folders owned by root, ubder other users account, and they are still allow to delete the file ow folder owned by root, how can i fix this issue
Does group have permission to delete?
no it does not
can you type ls -la path to file and pastebin it?
Problems with pastebin?
i'm working on it
sorry man i took step by step screen shoots, but still having problems with pastebin, maybe i can email it to you?
just past it here then
it is only one line right?
just waiting for u to accept it
What is the url?
hmm . Open the file copy the content and go to pastebin.com and past it there
Then give me the url. Clean and simple
Still problems ? I see that you wanted to send a 6mb file that is kinda big. I just need to know what permissions are set on the file
sorry i finally figure out how pastebin work, i got tow urls firs one is http://paste.ubuntu.com/441855/ and the seccond url http://paste.ubuntu.com/441856/
Which file on the list you deleted?
I see so you actually deleted the root-owned file?
that right
The thing is that you are on a directory that you have permission to delete. So make a directory that is owned by root and put the files owned by root in there
As I told you create a folder with root permission then the file that you want to be root in there
sorry i miss that
